title: Alibaug Beach
subtitle: A perfect blend of sun, sand, and historic charm near Mumbai
overview: Alibaug Beach is one of the most popular coastal destinations in Maharashtra, located about 100 kilometers from Mumbai. It offers a wide sandy stretch, coconut groves, and a stunning view of the Arabian Sea.
This beach is also known for the iconic Kolaba Fort, which can be accessed during low tide by foot or horse cart. The area is famous for its scenic sunsets, beach sports, and local seafood cuisine.
Being close to Mumbai and accessible by road and ferry, Alibaug is a favored weekend getaway for families, friends, and solo travelers alike.

highlights.title: Kolaba Fort
highlights.description: A historic sea fort accessible during low tide from the beach.

highlights.title: Sunset Views
highlights.description: Golden hour views over the Arabian Sea make Alibaug a romantic escape.

highlights.title: Beach Activities
highlights.description: Horse cart rides, ATV biking, and parasailing along the beach.

highlights.title: Ferry Access
highlights.description: Reach Alibaug via Mandwa Jetty and enjoy a scenic boat ride from Mumbai.

geography.intro: Alibaug lies in the Raigad district along the western coast of Maharashtra and features several beaches like Varsoli, Kihim, and Nagaon nearby.

details.label: Flora
details.value: Palm trees, coconut groves, and tropical plants

climate.description: Alibaug enjoys a humid tropical climate. The winters are pleasant and summers are warm with sea breeze.

geography.conclusion: Alibaug is known for its strategic coastal geography, beautiful beaches, and accessibility from Mumbai.

activities.title: Water Sports
activities.description: Engage in parasailing, jet skiing, and banana boat rides.
info: Operated on Alibaug and Nagaon Beach

activities.title: Horse Cart Rides
activities.description: Traditional horse-drawn cart rides along the shore.

activities.title: Ferry Ride
activities.description: Take a ferry from Gateway of India to Mandwa Jetty and a short ride to Alibaug.

attractions.title: Kolaba Fort
attractions.description: Sea fort with historical cannons and panoramic views.

attractions.title: Varsoli Beach
attractions.description: A quieter beach ideal for swimming and relaxation.

attractions.title: Kihim Beach
attractions.description: Famous for birdwatching, dense flora, and clean sand.

marineLife.intro: Alibaug Beach supports moderate marine biodiversity due to its clean tidal shores and low industrial activity.

items.title: Crabs & Shells
items.description: Commonly found across the wet sandy zones during low tide.

items.title: Bird Species
items.description: Frequent sightings of sea gulls, herons, and other migratory birds.

items.title: Tide Pools
items.description: Small pools that trap marine organisms offer natural exploration zones.

conclusion: Alibaug offers a simple marine experience perfect for kids and casual visitors.
Clean beaches help promote sustainable beach tourism and local fishing economy.

howToReach.title: By Ferry
details: Regular ferries from Gateway of India to Mandwa Jetty
20-minute bus/cab ride to Alibaug from Mandwa

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Approx. 3-hour drive from Mumbai via NH66
Buses and private cabs are easily available

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest station: Pen (30 km from Alibaug)
Connects to Mumbai and Konkan Railway routes

bookingTips.description: Plan 2 weeks ahead during weekends and holidays
Use ferry services to avoid road traffic
Look for stay-meal combos with activities
Parking can be limited during peak hours
